description.zh-cn: 一个由先锋派艺术家、知识分子和政治理论家组成的左翼国际组织，成立于1957年，解散于1972年，对欧洲现当代先锋艺术和激进哲学话语有极其重要影响。
description.en: A left-wing international organization of avant-garde artists, intellectuals, and political theorists, active from 1957 to 1972, which had a significant impact on contemporary European avant-garde art and radical philosophical discourse.

description.zh-cn: 指在艺术、文化或政治领域中具有实验性、激进性或非传统性的作品或人物。
description.en: Refers to works or people that are experimental, radical, or unorthodox with respect to art, culture, or society.

description.zh-cn: 一种政治派别，通常支持社会平等和社会正义，并寻求改变其认为社会中不平等的现状。
description.en: A political spectrum that typically supports social equality and egalitarianism, often in opposition to social hierarchy.

description.zh-cn: 对情境主义国际早期理论产生重要影响的先锋派艺术团体。
description.en: An avant-garde art group that significantly influenced the early theories of the Situationist International.

description.zh-cn: 对情境主义国际早期理论产生重要影响的先锋派艺术团体。
description.en: An avant-garde art group that significantly influenced the early theories of the Situationist International.

en: International Movement for an Imaginist Bauhaus

description.zh-cn: 对情境主义国际早期理论产生重要影响的先锋派艺术团体。
description.en: An avant-garde art group that significantly influenced the early theories of the Situationist International.

description.zh-cn: 一种以生产资料私有制为基础的经济体系，情境主义国际对其进行了系统性批判。
description.en: An economic system based on the private ownership of the means of production, which was systematically critiqued by the Situationist International.

description.zh-cn: 社会阶级之间因利益对立而产生的冲突。情境主义国际主张将其转换为“日常生活的革命”。
description.en: The conflict of interests between social classes. The Situationist International advocated for its transformation into the 'revolution of everyday life'.

description.zh-cn: 情境主义国际提出的一个关键概念，指对现有艺术和文化元素的挪用和再创造，以颠覆其原有意义。
description.en: A key concept of the Situationist International, referring to the reuse of preexisting artistic elements in a new ensemble to subvert their original meaning.

description.zh-cn: 1968年在法国发生的学生领导的抗议和总罢工。情境主义在此事件中扮演了思想上的重要角色。
description.en: A period of civil unrest in France in 1968, consisting of student-led protests and general strikes. Situationism played a significant ideological role in this event.

description.zh-cn: 情境主义国际的创始人，著有《景观社会》。
description.en: The founder of the Situationist International and author of 'The Society of the Spectacle'.

description.zh-cn: 居伊·德波的著作，情境主义国际的核心理论之一，认为商品社会正被“景观社会”取代。
description.en: A work by Guy Debord and one of the core theories of the Situationist International, which argues that commodity society is being replaced by the 'society of the spectacle'.

description.zh-cn: 情境主义国际的代表人物，著有《日常生活的革命》。
description.en: A representative figure of the Situationist International and author of 'The Revolution of Everyday Life'.

description.zh-cn: 拉乌尔·范内格姆的著作，情境主义国际的重要作品。
description.en: A work by Raoul Vaneigem and an important piece of the Situationist International.

description.zh-cn: 法国哲学家，其思想受情境主义国际深刻影响，成为消费社会批判理论和后现代思潮的关键人物。
description.en: A French philosopher whose thought was profoundly influenced by the Situationist International, becoming a key figure in critical theory of consumer society and postmodernism.

description.zh-cn: 居伊·德波是情境主义国际的创始人。
description.en: Guy Debord was the founder of the Situationist International.

description.zh-cn: 拉乌尔·范内格姆是情境主义国际的代表人物之一。
description.en: Raoul Vaneigem was one of the representative figures of the Situationist International.

description.zh-cn: 实验艺术家国际是对情境主义国际早期理论产生重要影响的先锋派团体之一。
description.en: The International of experimental artists was one of the avant-garde groups that significantly influenced the early theories of the Situationist International.

description.zh-cn: 字母主义运动是对情境主义国际早期理论产生重要影响的先锋派团体之一。
description.en: The Letterist Movement was one of the avant-garde groups that significantly influenced the early theories of the Situationist International.

description.zh-cn: 包豪斯印象运动国际是对情境主义国际早期理论产生重要影响的先锋派团体之一。
description.en: The International Movement for an Imaginist Bauhaus was one of the avant-garde groups that significantly influenced the early theories of the Situationist International.

description.zh-cn: 情境主义国际最初承袭于先锋派艺术，其成员也由先锋派艺术家、知识分子和政治理论家组成。
description.en: The Situationist International initially inherited from avant-garde art, and its members were composed of avant-garde artists, intellectuals, and political theorists.

description.zh-cn: 情境主义国际是一个左翼国际组织。
description.en: The Situationist International was a left-wing international organization.

description.zh-cn: 情境主义国际的理论批判资本主义，并主张将指向资本主义经济和政治制度的阶级斗争转换为“日常生活的革命”。
description.en: The theories of the Situationist International criticized capitalism and advocated for transforming the class struggle aimed at the capitalist economic and political system into a 'revolution of everyday life'.

description.zh-cn: 情境主义国际将心理学意义上的观念“异轨”作为其核心的艺术和政治实践方法之一，用以扬弃异化和反对拜物教。
description.en: The Situationist International promoted the concept of 'Détournement' as one of its core artistic and political practices to sublate alienation and oppose fetishism.

description.zh-cn: 在1968年法国“五月风暴”中，情境主义作为一种批判的艺术观念成为新型“文化革命”的战斗旗帜。
description.en: In the May '68 events in France, Situationism, as a critical artistic concept, became the fighting banner of a new 'cultural revolution'.

description.zh-cn: 情境主义国际的思想深刻影响了让·鲍德里亚，成为其消费社会批判理论和后现代思潮的关键性学术资源。
description.en: The ideas of the Situationist International profoundly influenced Jean Baudrillard, becoming a key intellectual resource for his critical theory of consumer society and postmodern thought.

description.zh-cn: 居伊·德波是《景观社会》的作者。
description.en: Guy Debord is the author of 'The Society of the Spectacle'.

description.zh-cn: 拉乌尔·范内格姆是《日常生活的革命》的作者。
description.en: Raoul Vaneigem is the author of 'The Revolution of Everyday Life'.
